meanings.definition: A person or thing that consummates or completes something.
meanings.sent1: The consummators of the project made sure every detail was perfect.
meanings.sent2: The team of consummators finalized the deal successfully.
meanings.sent3: The consummators of the puzzle celebrated by high-fiving each other.
meanings.sent4: Her words were the consummators that sealed their friendship forever.
meanings.sent5: The artist's final brushstroke acted as the consummators of the masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Those who bring something to a state of perfection or fulfillment.
meanings.sent1: The consummators of the plan ensured every aspect was flawless.
meanings.sent2: As consummators of happiness, they spread joy wherever they went.
meanings.sent3: The consummators of the party were the ones who brought the best snacks.
meanings.sent4: Their dedication was the consummators that transformed the ordinary into extraordinary.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret ingredient acted as the consummators of the dish, making it unforgettable.
